result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin R. Handford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Justin R. Handford, appeared with Attorney Brett A Ekes.   Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and case is resolved.  Amended Info. filed by the State.  DE pleads No Contest as amended; found guilty by the court.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Court imposes a fine of $500 plus costs.  Cash Bond on deposit is to be applied and any remaining balance to be returned to poster.  Appeal Rights given.
Judge kept the file following today's hearing.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Brett Ekes.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Defense motions heard.  Motion to impeach State witnesses with prior convictions held in abeyance to allow the State time to review the records; to be addressed on 3/10/16 at 1:00.   Motion to impeach re untruthful conduct - part of motions decided, and Attorney Cicchini to provide the court with amount of time witness spent in custody.  Motion to impeach witnesses with their probationary status, pending cases, and dismissed cases - argument heard and motion held in abeyance, to be decided on 3/10/16.  Motion to introduce McMorris evidence argued; Court will wait until evidence comes in to make a final decision.  Jury status hearing 3/10/16 at 1:00.  Jury trial 3/14/16 at 8:30.  Bond continued.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Brett Ekes.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Ekes will join in the motions filed by Atty Cicchini in the co-def. case on 12/21/15.  Motions to be heard  2/10/16 at 11:00 re both cases.  Bond continued.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Brett Ekes.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Ekes is new to the case and needs time to obtain and review discovery.  Jury status hearing changed from 3/17/16 to 3/10/16 at 1:00.  Jury trial changed from 3/21/16 to 3/14/16 at 8:30, at request of ADA Trigg.  FPT set for 1/20/16 at 1:30.  Any motions to be filed by 12/21/15 and will be heard on 1/20/16 at 1:30.  Bond continued.
Authorizing Withdrawal of Counsel.  Atty Dirk Jensen is allowed to withdraw.  Public Defender to appoint new counsel for def.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney D Jensen.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  STC set for 12/1/15 at 11:10am, JSH 3/17/16 at 1pm and JS 3/21/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
